item.title: Steel/Bronze/Iron Dragons! [RELEASE]
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:9, topic:304264”][quote author=badger41 link=topic=400553.msg3006327#msg3006327 date=1256435222]

I’ve never animated a NPC or anything for that matter, if you animate em’ will that mean that they actually move how their supposed to and not like if you haven’t set a emote server sided?

A model must be animated, before it can receive a server-sided animation to show.
[/quote]So is that a yes? Or a no?

With how they are right no, a server-sided animation will not work. The model must be animated itself before a server-sided animation shows. A models animation is just how it moves.

even then it will look gay, because it is telling the new npc to use animations from an older npc, you need the new animation files so the npc will move correctly

Ok first, this was a dead topic. Second, dont acuse me of being wrong like that. Since a non-animated model has no possible movements at all. One that is animated, will accept animations and move like it should. But without being animated, the animations wont even work. It will stand still, as the model shows.[/quote]

ok… first: i didnt accuse you of being wrong, i was adding the fact about the other animations, second: i didnt bring this topic back

Read full topic

item.title: Steel/Bronze/Iron Dragons! [RELEASE]
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:8, topic:304264”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=400553.msg2976767#msg2976767 date=1254339711]

I’ve never animated a NPC or anything for that matter, if you animate em’ will that mean that they actually move how their supposed to and not like if you haven’t set a emote server sided?

A model must be animated, before it can receive a server-sided animation to show.
[/quote]So is that a yes? Or a no?

With how they are right no, a server-sided animation will not work. The model must be animated itself before a server-sided animation shows. A models animation is just how it moves.

even then it will look gay, because it is telling the new npc to use animations from an older npc, you need the new animation files so the npc will move correctly[/quote]
Ok first, this was a dead topic. Second, dont acuse me of being wrong like that. Since a non-animated model has no possible movements at all. One that is animated, will accept animations and move like it should. But without being animated, the animations wont even work. It will stand still, as the model shows.

Read full topic

item.title: Steel/Bronze/Iron Dragons! [RELEASE]
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:6, topic:304264”][quote author=daone8 link=topic=400553.msg2975956#msg2975956 date=1254276891]

I’ve never animated a NPC or anything for that matter, if you animate em’ will that mean that they actually move how their supposed to and not like if you haven’t set a emote server sided?

A model must be animated, before it can receive a server-sided animation to show.
[/quote]So is that a yes? Or a no?

With how they are right no, a server-sided animation will not work. The model must be animated itself before a server-sided animation shows. A models animation is just how it moves.[/quote]

even then it will look gay, because it is telling the new npc to use animations from an older npc, you need the new animation files so the npc will move correctly

Read full topic

item.title: Steel/Bronze/Iron Dragons! [RELEASE]
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“daone8, post:5, topic:304264”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=400553.msg2975813#msg2975813 date=1254269972]

I’ve never animated a NPC or anything for that matter, if you animate em’ will that mean that they actually move how their supposed to and not like if you haven’t set a emote server sided?

A model must be animated, before it can receive a server-sided animation to show.
[/quote]So is that a yes? Or a no? :P[/quote]
With how they are right no, a server-sided animation will not work. The model must be animated itself before a server-sided animation shows. A models animation is just how it moves.

Read full topic
